question.text: The ratio between 2-carbon and 3-carbon intermediates having <math><mo>–</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">N</mi><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></math> group formed in photosynthetic oxidation cycle is

solution.text: During photorespiration in Peroxisome, two molecules of glycine (<math><mn>2</mn><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mi mathvariant="normal">N</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>-</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></math>) are transferred into mitochondrion, where they are converted into one molecule of serine (<math><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>-</mo><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mi mathvariant="normal">N</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi><mo>-</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></math>). Thus, the ratio between 2C and 3C intermediates having <math><mo>–</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">N</mi><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></math> group is 2:1.
